text: Hi folks - quick set of updates from my end.
I’ve been updating the Google Slides deck based on some early feedback and will continue to do so.

Today, I’m meeting w/ Jonathan to discuss the real estate numbers and make sure our projections are in place. That’s at 5:30. From there, I’ll have sufficient info to meet up with the Digital Trends guys.
Rick T has already taken a look and added some comments, which I need to apply to the incubator model.
I’ve pinged Robert from ZGF with the deck. I’m looking for his feedback on the professional services business model.
Hoping to meet w/ him on Wednesday.
I’ll also share the deck w/ Stephen Green (economist) and Nate Wildfire (Biz Oregon) once I have Jonathan’s updated numbers.
Secondary support from Josh Lifton (Crowd Supply) and Surj/Greg (Rigado) is on deck.
From there, I’ll be looking to meet w/ Kevin from Autodesk.
I’m going to be revising the competencies (in the source) as well as continuing to work on the story/philosophy
Awesome. Thanks, Lee.
marce - feel free to pull in Megan B for an edit check when needed

Things I need: 1.)Ballparks on the additional equipment we’ve suggested. 2.) Revised images of the space showing layout. 3.) An image for page 10 of the deck (Incubation, Mentorship, Community). I think we can repurpose some Ivan illustrations for it.
<@U02E3CRMA> - could you help w/ 1?
<@U0HPGQ4KH> - could you help w/ 2 and 3?
and <@U0914MEN7> - will do - almost there. Will share today.
<@U026NB2U2>: on #1 are you asking for ballpark $ amount or enumeration of equipment or both?
I used the equipment list sheet you had worked on.
And I had costed out some of the main Autodesk stuff but not the equipment in the gap list
<https://docs.google.com/a/uncorkedstudios.com/spreadsheets/d/1AHa2IE6MhOVYzpCLoMwYm5RGi7ogInB6vSZI6xAZxCs/edit?usp=sharing> Use the Equipment tab on this spreadsheet
sure thing - let’s team up <@U0K8ZSHN0>
thanks!
4). A bonus ask would be a second pass at my graphic on page 2 to match the PMMC styling.

Hello Marce. Great updates. To your points: Totally can help with 2. 

Not 100% sure what you need for 3 (page10) a more graphic illustration of Incubation, Mentorship and Community as a connected system or with the illustration of the 3D space?
just a graphic illustration - but I think we can convey Incubation + Mentorship + Community by putting those labels beneath some of the images Ivan has illustrated

Could also help with ask no.4 Did you mean page 3?

Overall question, are we bringing the deck into an Uncorked graphic format à la Intel Owels and Japanese Garden?
So I don’t think we need to create anything new
I don’t think we need to (yet) - I made it PMMC blue and added that branding to it.
And yes I meant page 3 for #4. :slightly_smiling_face:

<@U0HPGQ4KH|felix> uploaded a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/felix/F2MHECZND/pasted_image_at_2016_10_10_11_00.png|Can help with that. and how about a theme page with some images that give a feel for the space?>

file.name: Pasted image at 2016_10_10 11_00.png
file.title: Can help with that. and how about a theme page with some images that give a feel for the space?

text: And not to step on your graphic design abilities, but could we have one of our communication designers take the deck in the end and format it …?
haha - please - step all over it - was trying to keep my ask limited so as to not impose
and yes to the theme page - (maybe before the building page)? Let me pull from the most recent keynote
Ok. Let me find out who could help. And feel free to rearrange images based on different format (or ask me to make it somehow fit for now.
do you have the keynote?
I do have the keynote
Grabbed a screenshot and imported - seems to have fit as you had it.
(Removed PMMC in orange)
cool
<@U026NB2U2> do we need to include furniture as part of this list? For instance, calling out ESD-compatible chairs and tables
we have a general furniture budget - are these chairs special? If not, I would say we can capture them elsewhere for now.
special-ish - they’re designed to mitigate ESD for electronics work. We can spec that detail in the general furniture budget rather than calling out.
cool - let’s do that
some of these equipment mfgs do not want you to know how much their stuff costs
ha
google a used one for ballparks
order of magnitude is helpful

We will be able to work with Ali to help us on the visual side of the deck. Marce, do you have an original that she could work with? I think she’s got more time in the beginning of the week. Although not all is done I think it would be helpful to work with what we’ve got to create a Master for the deck. Marce, do you want to brief Ali yourself or shall I? And please remind me again why we use a different format to the latest docs that were shared with our recent potential clients. It’ll help Ali to understand what the essence of this deck is as well. Cheers
<@U026NB2U2> i took a first pass at additional equipment cost, ~$156k right now
i made it its own tab called add’l equipment
awesome thanks, lee
<@U0HPGQ4KH>: Dennis set up this template for ease of collaboration. My thinking on the different format is that theoretically this should be a deck from a consortium of companies, not just us.
So by making it PMMC blue it could be neutral
All the images and content in the deck came from a Google search - you should be able to export a powerpoint file out of there that will let her move things around. (She can go from PPT to Keynote).
If you have a chance to brief her that’d be great - I have a couple of back-to-back meetings coming up
Hello <@U026NB2U2> , sounds like she could should work in the native file format, which is what? a ppt or a google doc?
google slides
<https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1epQ7UNI8hvgfFfwpHUHAVBXj4quZYVUH86Z3ftyG388/edit#slide=id.g69e60cd62e1ffec_10>
Thanks, will brief her tomorrow
